title: 4 Simple Steps to Refresh the Group Policy Settings in Windows

steps.title: Run a command prompt as an administrator.
steps.content: Run a command prompt as an administrator. To do this, right-click and select run as administrator.

steps.title: A new window will display the console.
steps.content: A new window will display the console. Enter the command: "gpupdate /force" and press enter.

steps.title: Wait a moment.
steps.content: Wait a moment. Group Policy changes will be updated. The console displays:

steps.title: If you want to refresh Group Policy and restart the computer (for example, if with the update rules of the groups have yet to install the software), use the command "gpupdate /boot".
steps.content: If you want to refresh Group Policy and restart the computer (for example, if with the update rules of the groups have yet to install the software), use the command "gpupdate /boot". This will restart your computer and update the changes.
